- **Engagement and Emotional Impact:**  
  It's been a long time since I've had a hard time putting a book down, but leave it to Emma Scott to pull me out of my semi-reading funk. *Falling Like Stars* is another beautiful, heart-tugging read from Ms. Scott. I fully expected to cry all the tears, because Emma...duh, but surprisingly, it wasn't until 90% when the tears started flowing. Up until then, I had teared up a few times, but I really thought I'd make it through without a full-on cry, even with how emotional the storyline is. But she got me once again.

- **Character Development and Relatability:**  
  Zachary and Rowan are each a little broken and damaged, but there's a softness to them that was so endearing and made it easy to love them. They both had a lot to unpack when it came to past (and current) traumas. To see them work through it all and come out on the other side—not unscathed, not miraculously healed, but on their way—is a testament to Emma herself and all that she's gone through.

- **Themes and Message:**  
  This is a story of love and hope. It's a story about giving yourself grace, allowing yourself the time and space to grieve. It's a story that will captivate and charm you, and you'll have a hard time letting go.

- **Easter Eggs and Nostalgia:**  
  I loved the Easter eggs that were interspersed throughout the story! They brought back some wonderful and tearful memories and made me want to go back and reread some of my favorites.

**Conclusion:**  
*Falling Like Stars* is a deeply emotional and captivating novel that combines love, hope, and healing in a way that resonates long after the final page. Emma Scott's storytelling is as powerful as ever, and the characters' journeys are both relatable and inspiring.
